Using Processing to generate fancy stars. We all know how to make the familiar five pointed, straight-edged star: Make five points around a circle, and connect the dots by skipping a single point for each line. Letting the number of points and number of skips be variables, and turning the straight lines into bezier curves, a wide variety of stars can be produced. Processing code available here.

A full gallery can be found here. Below are some highlights.
